Cicero.Humboldt Park (Chicago park):
Humboldt Park is a 207-acre (84 ha) park located at 1400 North Sacramento Avenue, on the West Side of Chicago, Illinois.
The park was named for Alexander von Humboldt, a German naturalist and botanist.


== History ==

William Le Baron Jenney began developing the park in the 1870s, molding a flat prairie landscape into a "pleasure ground" with horse trails and a pair of lagoons.
